Heros

Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • Heros.Hero
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Hero>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Assassin, Mage, Paladin, SkeletonArcher, SkeletonBoss, SkeletonSpearMan, SkeletonWarrior, Soldier

    public abstract class Hero
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Hero>
    Hero abstract class, implements Comparable so the Heros can be sorted by speed when it comes time to initially create the battle system queue.
    Author:
    kevin

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hero

        public Hero(java.lang.String image,
            int experience,
            int level,
            int health,
            int abilityPoints,
            int defenseRating,
            int speed,
            java.lang.String controlledBy)
        Constructor to create an instance of the Hero class.
        Parameters:
        image: - image to be used by the view
        experience: - experience, not yet implemented
        level: - level, not yet implements
        health: - initial hero health, also sets the hero's maximum health
        abilityPoints: - initial hero ability points, also sets the hero's maximum ability points
        defenseRating: - hero's defense rating
        speed: - hero's speed rating, used for sorting to build initial battle queue order
        controlledBy: - controlled by field, has to be a final constant from either HumanPlayer or AI, determines where control is passed in the battle system

    • Method Detail

      • setAbilityCheckType

        public abstract void setAbilityCheckType(Ability ab)
        Method to confirm a Hero's ability belong to that Hero's subclass. Why abstract? Don't know the class type of the specific ability i.e for soldier must be of type SoldierAbility
        Parameters:
        ability -

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Hero other)
        Compare to first checks the hero's speed, then checks by class name.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Hero>
        Parameters:
        Hero: - hero to compare to

      • updateStatuses

        public boolean updateStatuses()
        The hero must update it's own statuses, the status class only adheres to a single status. Thus the hero iterates through it's own statuses and calls the individual status's update status method to update the hero's state.
        Returns:
        boolean: if the hero is crowd controlled no further action can be made on it's turn

      • checkIfEnoughAP

        public final void checkIfEnoughAP(Ability ability)
        Hero checks if it has enough ability points to perform an action.
        Parameters:
        ability - to determine if the hero has enough ability points to perform

      • getAbilities

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Ability> getAbilities()
        Generic method which returns the current hero's ability HashMap but allows them to be seen as BattleCommands as input to other methods if necessary.
        Returns:
        Current hero's ability HashMap but allows them to be seen as BattleCommands.

      • getAbilitiesNames

        public java.lang.String[] getAbilitiesNames()
        Returns an Array of names of the abilities in the heros ability set. Used to update the text for the current hero's ability buttons in the view.
        Returns:
        Array of names of the abilities in the heros ability set
